properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 8 at 12:42PM MST until February 9 at 9:00AM MST by NWS Rapid City SD
properties.description:
...SNOW LATE TODAY INTO TOMORROW...

.The next storm system will impact the area beginning this
afternoon. Heavy upslope snow is expected over the northern Black
Hills and adjacent foothills late tonight through tomorrow
morning, bringing several inches of new snow. Additionally, a band
of heavy snow will move across northwestern South Dakota this
afternoon and evening. High snowfall rates within this band could
lead to rapid onset of hazardous travel conditions. Snow showers
are expected elsewhere across northeastern Wyoming and western
South Dakota through tonight before tapering off early tomorrow.

* WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 10
inches with locally higher amounts possible. Winds gusting as
high as 35 mph.

* WHERE...The Northern Black Hills.

* WHEN...Until 9 AM MST Sunday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing
snow could significantly reduce visibility.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow is expected to arrive in two waves,
the first this afternoon and another overnight. The majority of
snowfall and travel impacts are expected to occur tonight into
early tomorrow morning.
properties.instruction:
A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather
conditions are expected. This will create dangerous conditions.

Road conditions are available on your smartphone from the
5 1 1 app for your state.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM MST SUNDAY
